bibl.title: Letter from Valery Havard to the Surgeon General, May 16, 1901

div1.p: Havard requests information as to whether Agramonte has been relieved of his duties with the investigation, or whether he is available to assist the needs of his department as bacteriologist.

div1.head: Letter from Valery Havard to the Surgeon General, May 16, 1901
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF SURGEON GENERAL
MAY 20
38657
T
1901
WAR DEPARTMENT.
Havana Cuba.
May 16, 01.
Chief Surg.
Asks to be informed if Cont. Surg.
A. Agramonte U.S.A. has been re-
lieved from the duties imposed
upon by Par 34 S.O. 122, A.G.O.
series 1900, or is he still expected
to continue the investigations descri-
bed in said order. Information is
desired, to know to what extent if
any his services as bacteriologist
are available for the current needs of
the Dept.
Agramonte
L.S.132, 1901. H.
HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
OFFICE OF CHIEF SURGEON,
HAVANA.
May 16th, 1901.
The Surgeon General, U.S.A.,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I respectfully request to be informed whether Contract
Surgeon A. Agramonte, U.S. Army, has been relieved from the duties
imposed by Par. 34, S.O. 122, A.G.O., series 1900, or if he is still
expected to continue the investigations described in said order.
This information is desired in order to know to what extent, if
any, his services as bacteriologist are available for the current
needs of the Department.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, V. Havard Major, Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Chief Surgeon.
